original_title: Sri Lanka rupee at 337/340 to US dollar
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s rupee was quoted around 337/340 to the US dollar in the spot market in intra-day trade, after opening wide at 336/344 levels Wednesday, dealers said.

Sri Lanka operated a consistent policy peg until March when the central bank was buying at selling dollars at around 360/370 and sales went down as domestic credit reduced the rupee came under upward pressure.
However, from March 07, exchange rate policy turned ad hoc and banks and dollar holders sold heavily and the central bank intervened at different rates to prevent appreciation.
Related ; Sri Lanka to operate ad hoc exchange rate peg from March 07
At current levels some banks who sold dollars would make losses, if they tried to cover open positions which were sold down below the level, analysts said.
Ad hoc policy pegs can depreciate even if monetary policy supportive of the currency due to lack of confidence and unwillingness of authorities to sell dollars back.
There has been some moral suasion in the market, participants said.
There is also a possibility of remittance reducing again, after a premium given to Vostro accounts was take off, market participants said.  (Colombo/Mar15/2023)
